definition: arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
(negative prefix)/not/no
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Susch parts are often considered to be thankless, unrewarding.
sentences.chinese: 这种角色通常被变为是吃力不讨好的。

sentences.english: Such parts are often considered to be thankless,unrewarding.
sentences.chinese: 这种角色通常被认为是吃力不讨好的。

sentences.english: Defining it is as unrewarding as dissecting a soapbubble.
sentences.chinese: 描述定义它和解剖肥皂泡泡一样吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: They seldom labour their wits on thankless task.
sentences.chinese: 他们很少为吃力不讨好的工作动脑筋。

sentences.english: Sending a sorry looking bunch of carnations might do you more harm than good.
sentences.chinese: 送一束看起来可怜兮兮的康乃馨可是吃力不讨好哇。

to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties

folly

to bring trouble on oneself
loss/to sustain losses
